name: Drinking in Season: Blood Orange Daiquiri
description: Looking for a little pick-me-up after the holidays, I decided a daiquiri—which is traditionally made with lime juice, rum and sugar—would be the perfect candidate for a little winter experimentation. The blood orange juice gives the cocktail a lovely red hue and brings a bright flavor to the drink.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 ounces freshly squeezed blood orange juice
2 ounces white rum, such as Denizen
Garnish: Blood orange slice or twist

recipeInstructions.text: To make the cinnamon simple syrup: Dissolve sugar in water in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add cinnamon sticks. Reduce heat to low, simmer for 10 minutes. Let cool, then strain out cinnamon sticks.
To make the cocktail, add blood orange juice, rum, lime, and cinnamon simple syrup to a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake well for 10 seconds.
Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish and serve.
